title: Inventory Optimization Playbook
goal: Reduce holding costs while maintaining 95% service level across high-volume SKUs.

summary.context: Demand volatility has increased 12% MoM. Safety stock was overstated for Widgets and Gadgets, driving excess capital tie-up.
quickWins: Shift replenishment cadence for Widgets from weekly to twice-weekly.
Consolidate slow-moving SKUs into pooled buffer at central DC.
Enable supplier flex order for peak weeks 24-26.

plan.title: Stage 1 · Diagnose
plan.description: Compile baseline metrics and identify high-cost segments.

activities.name: Run data ingest
activities.description: Compile demand, cost and service level inputs across all regions.
activities.impact: Identified 3 SKUs contributing 62% of excess cost.

activities.name: Highlight risk segments
activities.description: Surface SKUs with highest variance week-over-week.
activities.impact: Flagged Widgets & Gadgets as high-priority for scenario testing.

plan.title: Stage 2 · Simulate
plan.description: Test demand shocks and supply constraints to stress the plan.

activities.name: Demand spike scenario
activities.description: Model 20% spike in Widget demand for promotional weeks.
activities.impact: Requires 8% buffer increase to retain 95% service level.

activities.name: Supplier delay
activities.description: Simulate 3-day lead-time slip on Gadget supplier.
activities.impact: Introduced cross-dock mitigation to hold service level at 94%.

plan.title: Stage 3 · Commit
plan.description: Lock-in recommendations and publish stakeholder summary.

activities.name: Finalize reorder policy
activities.description: Adopt dynamic reorder point per SKU cluster.

activities.name: Share stakeholder brief
activities.description: Distribute plan across Ops, Finance, Merchandising.
activities.impact: Ensures change readiness before week 21 deployment.

whatIfs.title: What if demand spikes 30%?
whatIfs.summary: Increase safety stock by 12% for high-margin SKUs; maintain buffer only for premium customers.

whatIfs.title: What if supplier lead-time doubles?
whatIfs.summary: Trigger alternate supplier and expedite on-hand transfer; stock-out risk rises slightly but stays <3%.

unscheduled: Explore co-pack opportunities with supplier B
Evaluate automation to accelerate cycle counts
Assess impact of seasonal assortment refresh
notes: Data validated against ERP snapshot as of 2025-05-12.
Run refresh after week 21 promotional period.

itinerary.title: Kick-off & Baseline Diagnosis
entries: Run data ingest across demand, supply, and cost tables.
Surface SKUs with 4+ weeks of supply on hand.
Share opening synopsis with Ops leadership.

itinerary.title: Scenario Design & Forecast Refresh
entries: Simulate 20% Widget demand spike for weeks 24-26.
Align on updated forecast with merchandising.
Prep what-if brief for finance review.

itinerary.title: Supply Stress Test & Mitigation
entries: Run supplier lead-time slip scenario at 2x baseline.
Design cross-dock transfer mitigation for Gadgets.

itinerary.title: Policy Finalization
entries: Lock dynamic reorder rules in planning workbook.
Align finance and merchandising on go/no-go.
